questions.question: In the last century, what significantly improved the quality of life of people?
What had an explosive impact on the growth of population?
options: Increased health facilities and better living conditions
questions.answer: Increased health facilities and better living conditions

questions.question: What was the approximate world population in 1900?
What was the world population by the year 2000?
According to the paragraph, what was the world population in 2011?
What was the approximate population of India at the time of independence?
What was India's population by the year 2000?
What was India's population in May 2011?
Which factors are probable reasons for rapid population growth in India?
options: Decline in death rate, maternal mortality rate, infant mortality rate and increase in people of reproducible age
questions.answer: Decline in death rate, maternal mortality rate, infant mortality rate and increase in people of reproducible age

questions.question: Which program helped India marginally reduce population growth rate?
What was the population growth rate according to the 2011 census?
What could an alarming growth rate lead to?
options: Absolute scarcity of food, shelter and clothing
questions.answer: Absolute scarcity of food, shelter and clothing

questions.question: What is the most important step to overcome rapid population growth?
options: Motivate smaller families by using contraceptive methods
questions.answer: Motivate smaller families by using contraceptive methods

questions.question: Which slogan is used in media campaigns to motivate smaller families?
What trend have many young, urban, working couples adopted regarding children?
What is the statutory marriageable age for females in India?
What is the statutory marriageable age for males in India?
Which measure is given as incentive to couples with small families?
options: Tax exemption only for large families

questions.question: What characteristics should an ideal contraceptive have?
options: User-friendly, easily available, effective, reversible, least side-effects
questions.answer: User-friendly, easily available, effective, reversible, least side-effects

questions.question: Which of the following should an ideal contraceptive NOT interfere with?
Into which broad categories can contraceptive methods be grouped?
options: Natural/Traditional, Barrier, IUDs, Oral contraceptives, Injectables, Implants, Surgical methods
questions.answer: Natural/Traditional, Barrier, IUDs, Oral contraceptives, Injectables, Implants, Surgical methods
